Package Brewmaster

Class BrewMaster

java.lang.Object
Brewmaster.BrewMaster
public class BrewMaster
extends java.lang.Object

BrewMaster

The BrewMaster program reads the temperature of a probe connected to a raspberry pi and uses it
to control the temperature of a refrigerator. It does this by switching the refrigerator on
and off with a wireless relay (ex.tp-link hs100) based on a settings file you can control various
aspects of this process.
Since:
2020-23-9

  • Constructor Details

    • BrewMaster

      public BrewMaster()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] a)
      This is the main method which sets up the program and controls the main loop. It takes the file given as input and tries to load it as a Settings object then it sets up TemperatureHandler and TempWorker it tries to control the temperature and log information the way it's specified in Settings
      Parameters:
      a - Array of arguments passed to the program (should contain path to settings file at positon 0).

    • getInput

      private static java.lang.String getInput​(java.lang.String[] a)
      Gets the first argument of string array or exits with code -1 if it is empty
      Parameters:
      a - Path to settings file.
      Returns:
      String containing the string in position 0 of a[] or nothing if a is empty

    • run

      private static void run​(java.lang.String file)
      Sets up the settings file, TemperatureHandler and a new thread running ServerThread.then starts the program loop while(true) TemperatureHandler.run()
      Parameters:
      file - String file with path of settings file
      See Also:
      Settings, TemperatureHandler
